text:
"Fighter" with overloads, ex-policeman, associates of Presman and Kissa: who will manage the districts of Odessa region on behalf of Ze
07 Nov 2019, 16:52 by Nikolay Mazur

The Cabinet agreed yesterday
candidacies of the leaders of 21 district administrations of Odessa region at once, which now must be approved by President Vladimir Zelensky. Most of their names told us nothing at once, and we even thought that here they are, the very ‚Äúnew faces‚Äù that the president spoke about. However, when
a detailed study revealed that this is not entirely true.

So, for example, Nikolay Chekal, who previously headed the regional department of Ukrtransbescurity, will head the Liman district state administration, and even earlier worked in the tax and police. Ukrainian officials, as you know, are not without sin, however, this agency is considered one of the most ‚Äúvulgar‚Äù, as Vladimir Zelensky puts it. It is she who is responsible for the safety of transport and the compliance of truck weights with standards. In the Odessa region, a large number of scandals and conflicts are associated with Ukrtransbasezhnost ‚Äî recall at least shooting at Dachnoye. Former governor Maxim Stepanov has repeatedly accused the "transport security" of corruption and unwillingness to exercise systemic and honest control over overloads, threatened, shouted, but did not achieve anything.




Nikolay Chekal

By the way, Svetlana Shatalova, Deputy Stepanova, who headed the Regional State Administration for some time, described the newly-minted head of the Liman region as follows: ‚ÄúEveryone saw well how Chekal‚Äú directed ‚ÄùUTB. How "good and high-quality" work with overloads is established. Complete management failure, in my opinion. Having the most powerful material and technical base in Ukraine, it is so inept to flood work. And now this person will lead the area? It's humiliating. The most powerful district of Odessa region does not deserve such a leader, ‚Äùthe ex-official on Facebook wrote.
As the head of the Izmail RGA, Natalia Todorova, who took her in June 2017, is left. The 39-year-old native of the village of Kalanchak worked for many years in the district administration, and headed the communal services department of the Izmail City Hall. They say about such people - ‚Äúa strong business manager‚Äù.



Natalia Todorova
They did not begin to rack their brains with the Bolgrad region - they plan to approve the 39-year-old Andrei Kuchmiev, who is now acting, as the head of the RSA. He is a native of Anthracite of the Luhansk region, was engaged in business, in 2010-2015 he worked in the structure of the State Emergency Service, headed the state certification center of the department. He has been in the district administration since September 2018 and seems to be comfortable with the new government.



Andrey Kuchmiev
The situation is different with the Belgorod-Dniester region. They haven‚Äôt found any proven personnel here and are going to appoint a ‚Äúnew face‚Äù - Anna Yatsishenu, assistant to the people's deputy Alexei Leonov. She has no experience in civil service, but in the police - more than enough. In the police, she rose to the rank of lieutenant colonel, was a senior investigator of the Primorsky regional department. Among other things, she was engaged in the investigation of a fraud in the credit union "Ukraine", which has gained the hatred of hundreds of deceived members of the latter: the case has safely stalled.
The Artsyz district will be headed by an experienced auditor Denis Bailuk, who spent the last years in the chair of the deputy head of the inspection department in the agro-industrial complex and the field of natural resources use of the regional audit department of the State Audit Service. By the way, his wife claims to be the head of the social protection department of the Belyaev RSA.



Denis Bailuk
Tarutino administration should be headed by an experienced farmer, Poltava Vladimir Orekhovsky. Behind his shoulders is work at the Odessa Breeding and Genetic Institute, where he, as deputy director, improved the quality and quantity of seed production. In addition, he led the Donetsk State Experimental Agricultural Station in Sands for two years.



Vladimir Orekhovsky
Already in the midst of hostilities, in June 2014, Orekhovsky conducted a seminar right in the field with the participation of the leading producers of the region, and then literally in manual mode organized the harvesting of testes, thanks to which the gene pool of wheat and barley of the Donetsk region was saved.
To agrarians, and to whom - energy! If the president supports the Cabinet of Ministers, Yevgeny Kabatov will become the new head of the Saratsky region. He has no experience in civil service, but there is the Energo-Center KG company (Kharkov). They write about her that she "is one of the leading enterprises in eastern Ukraine engaged in the design, construction, wiring and maintenance of energy facilities."
Zakharyevsky district will be given into the strong hands of Anton Muravenko, who in 2013-2014 led the regional communal enterprise ‚ÄúBureau of Regional Development‚Äù, developed various projects that were never implemented. Member of the Party of Regions.



Anton Muravenko



On the VKontakte page of Muravenko - veterans, St. George‚Äôs tapes, anti-Ukrainian collages and grief for the victims of May 2 in the House of Trade Unions
Until recently, he was an assistant to a people's deputy (already a former), also ex-regional Alexander Presman, in whose interests he delivered grocery sets, icons and Easter gifts to villages for World War II veterans and senior citizens.
The Kodymsky district will be headed by businessman Dmitry Krisanov, who, according to some reports, is the protege of the deputy of the regional council from the Fatherland Mikhail Lazarenko. At the last election, he worked for a candidate from the Servant of the People Alexander Mukonin. He lives in Balta, is engaged in the trade in bread.
Yury Golovin, head of the Interglobal company registered in Odessa, will steer the Berezovsky district - the structure has an authorized capital of 50 thousand hryvnias and is engaged in the provision of financial, insurance and brokerage services, as well as the leasing of its own or leased property.
The post of the head of the richest Belyaevsky region agreed on the candidacy of a lawyer Andrei Romanenko. Little is known about him: in the income statement he indicated apartments in Odessa and Novaya Kakhovka, a house in Novaya Kakhovka, and also a room in one of Odessa's dormitories. In addition, Romanenko heads a public organization registered in Dobroslav under the strange name ‚ÄúRegional Organization of Anti-Corruption Lustration and the Fight against Organized Crime‚Äù.
An experienced person will head the Ivanovo district - Roman Kiryak. In politics, for a long time, even during the time of President Viktor Yushchenko, he was a deputy of the district council from the "Fatherland", worked as a journalist in the newspaper "Steppe Dawn", from where he was ... fired for absenteeism. Subsequently, he spent many years in the civil service, in particular, he worked as the chief specialist for interaction with local authorities in the same Ivanovo district administration.
The head of the Kiliyskiy district administration will be businessman Vyacheslav Semenyuk. He owns 50% of the authorized capital in the company IC SK Trans, which is engaged in the sale and maintenance of vehicles.
The Lyubashev RGA will be entrusted to yet another entrepreneur Gennady Bambura, who owns the local agricultural company Ceres. Previously, he headed the local branch of PrivatBank, then he worked at the companies Vendor Finance and Ukrainian Microfinance Network. His wife Tatyana works in the district state administration as the deputy head of the department for personified registration of persons with disabilities, war and labor veterans.



Gennady Bambura
The Nikolaev district will be headed by an experienced official Denis Dragan - he had previously worked in the district administration as the head of the state registration sector, and from 2017 to 2019 he was the state registrar in the KP ‚ÄúRegional State Registration Bureau‚Äù of the Novoselovsky Village Council. In the last election, he was the local curator of the Ze-Team.



Denis Dragan
Podolsky district will be in the hands of an experienced railwayman. The new head of the district administration will be the long-term head of the Podolsk Construction and Installation Operational Administration of the Odessa Railway Vitaly Dragomaretsky. By the way, earlier he ran for the post of mayor of Podolsk from the party "Our Land" ex-regional Anton Kiss.



Vitaly Dragomaretsky
Sergey Prikhodko, who is well versed in local political realities, marks the chair of the head of the Razdelnyanskaya district administration - he was previously a deputy of the district council from the Bloc Petro Poroshenko's Solidarity party.



Sergey Prikhodko
A certified manager, Doctor of Science in Public Administration, Associate Professor of the Department of Management of the National Aerospace University named after N.E. Zhukovsky Sergey Stepanenko. True, he has nothing to do with the Odessa region, and he worked in Kharkov almost all his life. Judging by the financial declaration, the new official is a poor man. Over the past year, he earned only 48 thousand hryvnias (4 thousand per month) at the aerospace university. At the same time, Stepanenko holds 60 thousand UAH in cash. He doesn‚Äôt have a car, and as a real estate he has a tiny apartment of 36 sq.m. in Novovorontsovka, Kherson region. He has no family.
Another "paratrooper" will head the Tatarbunar district - this is Andrey Chechilo, who spent the previous years in the Kiev region, working in various positions in the city council of the city of Vishnevoe, Kiev-Svyatoshinsky district. He resigned as vice mayor on the activities of executive authorities. In 2015, he ran for the city council from the Opposition Bloc.
The candidacy of the entrepreneur Alexander Demyanenko, who is the director of the Vneshinveststroy construction company, was agreed on for the post of head of the Velikomykhailovsky region. Until 2017, he owned several companies in Odessa and Teplodar, as well as land in Shabo and Sychavka. Subsequently, however, they were copied to other persons.
Petr Gordienko, who now heads the department of education, culture and youth policy in it, should be appointed chairman of the Shirev RGA.



Petr Gordienko
Interestingly, before being appointed head of the department, he worked for the Shirevoagroshlyakhbud company, which regularly supplies gas and diesel to the department. 3and the last two years, the company concluded with the department 18 contracts for a total of 4 million 149 thousand UAH. Conflict of interest? Have not heard of this.

Authors - Nikolay Mazur and Victor Bosnyak
